fields.name: version
fields.description: Message version (0x00 for this version, only in V1 format)

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the requested task, set to zero for infinite duration. The maximum supported time is 12 days.

bits.name: backup
bits.description: The receiver goes into backup mode for a time period defined by duration, provided that it is not connected to USB

bits.name: force
bits.description: Force receiver backup while USB is connected. USB interface will be disabled.

fields.name: wakeupSources
fields.description: Configure pins to wake up the receiver. The receiver wakes up if there is either a falling or a rising edge on one of the configured pins.

bits.name: uartrx
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the UART RX pin

bits.name: uartRx
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the UART RX pin

bits.name: uarttx
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the UART RX pin

bits.name: extint0
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT0 pin

bits.name: extInt0
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT0 pin

bits.name: extint1
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT1 pin

bits.name: extInt1
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT1 pin

bits.name: spics
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the SPI CS pin

annotations.message: V0 format (8 bytes, no version field) differs significantly from V1 format (16 bytes, with version field).
annotations.details: V0 starts with duration@0, V1 starts with version@0. Both may be labeled as "version 0" in some manuals.
